result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF1099, Court grants the State's motion.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Chelsea Williamson on behalf of attorney Peter M Wolff.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they are here for a bail hearing.  State requests that bail remain as set. Care Manager Naomi N. made statements. Court denies the bail motion. Bail stands as fixed. Court will set the matter over.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wolff advised court defendant is no longer challenging competency. Court conducted colloquy with the defendant. Court found defendant competent to proceed.   Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant Isaac Richard Tanner in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff requests a competency evaluation.  Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
